basic.description: This course covers a broad range of computational methods and their applications to electrical engineering. Methods include solution of equations, matrices, differentiation, integration, solution of differential equations, Fourier analysis, and boundary-value problems. Applications include circuit analysis, signal analysis, signal processing, electromagnetics, and optics.
basic.subject: EEL
basic.title: Computational Electrical Engineering

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: CGS 3408, EEE 3300, EEL 3135, EEL 3472, and EEL 3512.
